review.title: Spectral Analysis of Projection Histogram for Enhancing Close matching character Recognition in Malayalam
review.abstract: The success rates of Optical Character Recognition (OCR) systems for printed Malayalam documents is quite impressive with the state of the art accuracy levels in the range of 85-95% for various. However for real applications, further enhancement of this accuracy levels are required. One of the bottle necks in further enhancement of the accuracy is identified as close-matching characters. In this paper, we delineate the close matching characters in Malayalam and report the development of a specialised classifier for these close-matching characters. The output of a state of the art of OCR is taken and characters falling into the close-matching character set is further fed into this specialised classifier for enhancing the accuracy. The classifier is based on support vector machine algorithm and uses feature vectors derived out of spectral coefficients of projection histogram signals of close-matching characters.

sections.heading: IV. RESULTS, DISCUSSIONS AND CONCLUSION
sections.text: We first extracted the closely matched character training sets from the full dataset and divided them into two equivalent training and test sets with an extracted N. We calculated the discrete Fourier transformation coefficients (DFT) and discarded half of the coefficient and created a feature vector for each of the closely matched character sets. We used a Support Vector Machine (SVM) to develop the classification tool. SVMs use an improvement in n-dimensional plane separation achieved by traditional artificial neural networks.
